claim: Recombinant technology leads to a broader immune response that may provide cross-protection, even in a mismatch season.
explanation: A table reporting vaccine effectiveness (VE, %) with 95% confidence intervals for recombinant influenza vaccine quadrivalent (RIV4) versus standard-dose inactivated influenza vaccine quadrivalent (SD-IIV4) in adults aged 18–64 and ≥65 years, stratified by overall, sex, risk condition status, and by 2018–2019 and 2019–2020 seasons (with an additional column for high-dose/adjuvanted vaccines in ≥65). The table shows comparative VE percentages for RIV4 versus SD-IIV4 across age groups and seasons but does not specify vaccine–strain mismatch seasons or demonstrate cross-protection data against heterologous strains. Therefore, it does not support the claim that recombinant technology leads to broader immunity and cross-protection in mismatch seasons. Note: Analysis limited to visible data; seasonal mismatch status is not indicated in the table.
